page.title: 07LOCAL HISTORY -JILL'S NAN.
page.content: Things about school 60years ago. All the desks were wooden ones with hinged seats.Writing was done with pen and real ink from an ink well in the desk.You could leave school at aged 14 years.Lessons were nearly the same as ours but Maths was called Arithmetic, girls learned needlework and in some Junior schools boys did gardening.PE. was called P.T.(Physical Training) and girls had to wear black gymstockings, black gymslips and white blouse.Boys had to wear shorts and a white singlet (vest).Boys usually played football and cricket and girls played rounders.There were no swimming lessonsn then.If you were naughty you might get the cane off the teacher,so you had to be good. Playground games were skipping,Top and Whip,Hopscotch and only boys played marbles. Jill Mason.
